Psychology_tweet_19_r$Psychology_264_r$P.text:
Finding A: Crying first worsens, but then lifts sad mood after a certain time delay. Background:
Finding B: The researchers found that students who engaged in casual sex reported higher overall wellbeing.
Finding C: Circumcised boys in non-Muslim families were also more likely to develop hyperkinetic disorder (HR ¼ 1.81; 95% CI: 1.11-2.96).
Finding D: The increased risk of ASD in circumcised boys under the age of 5 years was present among boys in both Muslim and non-Muslim families ( Table 2) .

Psychology_105_p$Psychology_599_r$Psycho.text:
Finding A: We found significant and specific maturational lag in connections within default mode network (DMN) and in DMN interconnections with two task positive networks (TPNs): frontoparietal network and ventral attention network.
Finding B: While children in both groups made progress, those receiving ESDM showed significantly higher gains in language (20 DQ points versus 10 in the control group) and cognition (14 DQ points, versus 7 in the control group).
Finding C: Although previous studies have found changes in patients with depression in some of the regions of interest identified in this study, including the precuneus and angular gyrus, 43 this is to our knowledge the first study to examine the neural mechanisms underlying the associations of depressive problems with sleep quality and to associate sleep quality with functional connectivity in a large sample of participants.
Finding D: New research: "pseudomature behaviour predicted difficulties in social functioning ten years later" via @username mag

Finding B: While children in both groups made progress, those receiving ESDM showed significantly higher gains in language (20 DQ points versus 10 in the control group) and cognition (14 DQ points, versus 7 in the control group).
Finding C: Although previous studies have found changes in patients with depression in some of the regions of interest identified in this study, including the precuneus and angular gyrus, 43 this is to our knowledge the first study to examine the neural mechanisms underlying the associations of depressive problems with sleep quality and to associate sleep quality with functional connectivity in a large sample of participants.

Psychology_121_r$Psychology_56_r$Psychol.text:
Finding A: A spike in cortisol in athletesa saliva before competition, they wrote, would support the idea that apsychosocial stressorsa can have as strong a biological effect as actual danger.
Finding B: "Consumers who knew they had received a targeted ad reported being more interested in the advertised product, and even changed their self-perceptions to be more in line with what the ad implied about them," she explains.
Finding C: The group that had been asleep were better at remembering the German translations of the Dutch words they had heard in their sleep.
Finding D: Furthermore, we found an impact of labels on intensity ratings for one of the administered odors that goes against our hypothesis.

Finding A: A spike in cortisol in athletesa saliva before competition, they wrote, would support the idea that apsychosocial stressorsa can have as strong a biological effect as actual danger.
Finding B: "Consumers who knew they had received a targeted ad reported being more interested in the advertised product, and even changed their self-perceptions to be more in line with what the ad implied about them," she explains.
Finding C: The group that had been asleep were better at remembering the German translations of the Dutch words they had heard in their sleep.
Finding D: Furthermore, we found an impact of labels on intensity ratings for one of the administered odors that goes against our hypothesis.

Psychology_0_p$Psychology_444_r$Psycholo.text:
Finding A: Results: With a total of 4986 ASD cases, our study showed that regardless of cultural background circumcised boys were more likely than intact boys to develop ASD before age 10 years (HR ¼ 1.46; 95% CI: 1.11-1.93).
Finding B: Even before treatment started, levels of interleukin-10 were higher among the 18 patients who later developed long-term fatigue, suggesting the immune system may have been primed to overreact, the study authors explained.
Finding C: Unexpected brain plasticity revealed for the human visual system after cataract removal.
Finding D: The study\'s findings showed that, regardless of cultural background, circumcised boys may run a greater risk of developing ASD.

Finding A: a plastic spoon is light), yoghurt seemed denser and more expensive.
Finding B: The findings suggest that music instruction helps enhance skills that are critical for academic success.
Finding C: Notably, here too with emotional memories, we found a significant association between ΔRecall nap and ΔRecall overnight such that declines in accuracy across the nap were associated with improvements across overnight sleep (B = −0.488, p = 0.029; 95% CI: [−1.294, −0.079]; Fig.
Finding D: Really fascinating: A 20-yr cohort study of nearly 200,000 women shows that depression is associated with a 2-fold increase in the risk of developing lupus. All the more reasons to pay attention to #MentalHealth!

Psychology_tweet_161_r$Psychology_408_p$.text:
Finding A: Power of touch ✋️in relieving pain
Finding B: After adjusting for age, the cumulative incidence of T2DM was significantly higher in those with PTSD vs those without (patients with PTSD: 6.6%; patients without PTSD: 4.7%; P = .002); the same pattern occurred with respect to incidence rate (patients with PTSD: 15.2 per 1000 person-years; patients without PTSD: 11.4 per 1000 person-years; P = .01).
Finding C: Results: With a total of 4986 ASD cases, our study showed that regardless of cultural background circumcised boys were more likely than intact boys to develop ASD before age 10 years (HR ¼ 1.46; 95% CI: 1.11-1.93).
Finding D: Most concerning is the potential that the combination of age appropriate sexual motivation and interest, limited sexual knowledge and experiences, and additional social deficits, may place adolescents and young adults with ASD at increased risk for sexual violence victimization.

Finding A: Power of touch ✋️in relieving pain
Finding B: After adjusting for age, the cumulative incidence of T2DM was significantly higher in those with PTSD vs those without (patients with PTSD: 6.6%; patients without PTSD: 4.7%; P = .002); the same pattern occurred with respect to incidence rate (patients with PTSD: 15.2 per 1000 person-years; patients without PTSD: 11.4 per 1000 person-years; P = .01).
Finding C: Results: With a total of 4986 ASD cases, our study showed that regardless of cultural background circumcised boys were more likely than intact boys to develop ASD before age 10 years (HR ¼ 1.46; 95% CI: 1.11-1.93).
Finding D: Most concerning is the potential that the combination of age appropriate sexual motivation and interest, limited sexual knowledge and experiences, and additional social deficits, may place adolescents and young adults with ASD at increased risk for sexual violence victimization.

Psychology_52_r$Psychology_tweet_3_p$Psy.text:
Finding A: Published in Molecular Autism, the research reveals disruptions in the brain\'s circuitry involved in ToM at multiple levels compared to typical brain functioning.
Finding B: Conclusions: The absence of a gestational connection to the mother may be more problematic for children than the absence of a genetic link.
Finding C: Conclusion: These findings add support to theories that high-level multisensory body representations can interact with homeostatic regulation and pain perception.
Finding D: The researchers conclude that increased functional connectivity among these brain regions provides a neural basis for how depression is related to poor sleep quality.

Finding C: Conclusion: These findings add support to theories that high-level multisensory body representations can interact with homeostatic regulation and pain perception.
Finding D: The researchers conclude that increased functional connectivity among these brain regions provides a neural basis for how depression is related to poor sleep quality.

Psychology_169_p$Psychology_431_p$Psycho.text:
Finding A: Thus, music training initiated as late as adolescence can enhance neural processing of sound and confer benefits for language skills.
Finding B: This demonstrates the importance of assessing disturbed sleep in the presence of other, well-established and robust risk factors for suicide.
Finding C: Simple slope analyses indicated that high-SOI participants who had casual sex over the academic year had higher self-esteem (B ¼ 0.14, SE ¼ 0.06, p ¼ .025) and marginally lower depression (B ¼ À0.12, SE ¼ 0.07, p ¼ .091) and anxiety (B ¼ À0.11, SE ¼ 0.06, p ¼ .086) than high-SOI participants who did not have casual sex (Figure 3) .
Finding D: The proposition is supported if the gradient of decline for the no-gum group is significantly steeper than that for the chewing-gum group.

Finding A: Thus, music training initiated as late as adolescence can enhance neural processing of sound and confer benefits for language skills.
Finding B: This demonstrates the importance of assessing disturbed sleep in the presence of other, well-established and robust risk factors for suicide.
Finding C: Simple slope analyses indicated that high-SOI participants who had casual sex over the academic year had higher self-esteem (B ¼ 0.14, SE ¼ 0.06, p ¼ .025) and marginally lower depression (B ¼ À0.12, SE ¼ 0.07, p ¼ .091) and anxiety (B ¼ À0.11, SE ¼ 0.06, p ¼ .086) than high-SOI participants who did not have casual sex (Figure 3) .
Finding D: The proposition is supported if the gradient of decline for the no-gum group is significantly steeper than that for the chewing-gum group.

Psychology_293_p$Psychology_tweet_73_p$P.text:
Finding A: We found that all 39 links significantly mediated the relationship between the PSQI sleep quality and the depressive problem score (using FDR correction, p<0.05, Table S4 ).
Finding B: A significant positive association emerged for the association between corporal punishment and physical perpetration of dating violence, with an OR of 1.30 (95% CI 1.07-1.59).
Finding C: The findings extend previous research in showing that the eye-closure instruction can still be effective when witnesses are interviewed repeatedly, and that it can facilitate the elicitation of new information.
Finding D: But perhaps the most important aspect of the study was that it showed how autonomy support leads to positive outcomes in employees.

Finding A: We found that all 39 links significantly mediated the relationship between the PSQI sleep quality and the depressive problem score (using FDR correction, p<0.05, Table S4 ).
Finding B: A significant positive association emerged for the association between corporal punishment and physical perpetration of dating violence, with an OR of 1.30 (95% CI 1.07-1.59).
Finding C: The findings extend previous research in showing that the eye-closure instruction can still be effective when witnesses are interviewed repeatedly, and that it can facilitate the elicitation of new information.
Finding D: But perhaps the most important aspect of the study was that it showed how autonomy support leads to positive outcomes in employees.

Psychology_49_p$Psychology_144_r$Psychol.text:
Finding A: In Shenzhen City: 21,420 children were screened and 35 cases of autism were identified, resulting in a mainstream prevalence of 42 per 10,000 (95% CI 20-89).
Finding B: It found that many participants attributed their ability to stay HIV negative to a strong sense of religious and spiritual identity, social support from friends and family, and social engagement with other HIV-negative black MSM in safe spaces.
Finding C: @username The circumcision, #acetaminophen & autism studies: (Circumcision is associated w/ autism & ADHD only after Danish guidelines suggest Tylenol use-boys <5yrs only) Animal model Efficacy?
Finding D: In total,19 percent of the young volunteers involved in the study reported that they had been physically abusive to a partner during a dating relationship and 68 percent of the volunteers reported to experiencing corporal punishment as children.
